text.p: Barrick Goldstrike Mines Inc, a unit of Barrick Gold Corp, and Newmont Gold Co said on Tuesday they settled their dispute over water disposal on land called the Carlin Trend in Nevada.

"The agreement provides for the construction of a water treatment facility and conveyance system to be built by Barrick across Newmont property within Boulder Valley, immediately south of the mining operations," they said.
"Newmont has the right to use up to half the discharge system capacity in later years in exchange for payment for designated capital and operating," they said.
Ligitation concerning the dispute was dismissed, they said. Barrick plans to reimburse Newmont's legal costs.
Barrick will also provide Newmont with a property connected to its Deep Star Mine.
The property holds a resource of about 150,000 ounces of gold, they said.
